com.brightcove.player.view

Class BrightcoveClosedCaptioningView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.FrameLayout
          • com.brightcove.player.view.BrightcoveClosedCaptioningView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent, Component

    @Emits(events="captionsAvailable")
@ListensFor(events={"didLoadCaptions","progress","setCaptionsState","toggleClosedCaptions"})
public class BrightcoveClosedCaptioningView
extends android.widget.FrameLayout
implements Component

      • getSafeAreaWidth

        public int getSafeAreaWidth()
        Computes the FCC "safe-area margin" width based on the current width of this instance and the SAFE_AREA. Since Android defines margin as outside of the view and padding as within, the value returned by this method should be considered the minimum amount of padding for the CaptionsView itself.
        Returns:
        the size of the safe area in pixels

      • getSafeAreaHeight

        public int getSafeAreaHeight()
        Computes the FCC "safe-area margin" height based on the current height of this instance and the SAFE_AREA. Since Android defines margin as outside of the view and padding as within, the value returned by this method should be considered the minimum amount of padding for the CaptionsView itself.
        Returns:
        the size of the safe area in pixels

      • findCaptionForPosition

        public android.view.ViewGroup findCaptionForPosition(java.lang.Integer position)
        Retrieves the specific view block containing rendered captions for the given video position in milliseconds, if one exists. If there are no captions at the given position, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        position - the video position in milliseconds
        Returns:
        a ViewGroup containing the rendered captions, or null if there are no captions at the given video position

      • prepareDFXPCaptions

        public void prepareDFXPCaptions(TTMLDocument document)
        Prepares the rendered View blocks for all captions listed in the given TTMLDocument. This initially clears the state of the current caption blocks and time position mapping.
        Parameters:
        document - the TTMLDocument containing the captions to prepare

      • getCaptionTextAlignAsGravity

        protected int getCaptionTextAlignAsGravity(BrightcoveClosedCaption closedCaption)
        Translates the text alignment of the caption block to a Gravity value. If the caption does not have an explicit text alignment, DEFAULT_HORIZONTAL_GRAVITY is returned as a default.
        Parameters:
        closedCaption - the caption block
        Returns:
        Gravity.LEFT, Gravity.RIGHT, or DEFAULT_HORIZONTAL_GRAVITY

      • getCaptionDisplayAlignAsGravity

        protected int getCaptionDisplayAlignAsGravity(BrightcoveClosedCaption closedCaption,
                                  TTMLDocument document)
        Translates the display alignment of the caption block region to a Gravity value. The document is used to look up the region and its properties. If the caption block does not have a region or the region does not have a display align property, DEFAULT_VERTICAL_GRAVITY is returned as a default.
        Parameters:
        closedCaption - the caption block
        document - the document containing the block
        Returns:
        Gravity.TOP, Gravity.BOTTOM, or DEFAULT_VERTICAL_GRAVITY

      • getCaptionDisplayAlignAsGravity

        protected int getCaptionDisplayAlignAsGravity(BrightcoveClosedCaption closedCaption,
                                  WebVTTDocument document)

      • getLayoutParamsForBlock

        protected android.widget.FrameLayout.LayoutParams getLayoutParamsForBlock(android.view.View view)
        Returns the captions block view layout params as a FrameLayout.LayoutParams instance. If the layoutParams of the view has not already been set, a default instance with ViewGroup.LayoutParams.WRAP_CONTENT width and height is created; otherwise, a new instance is constructed with the copy constructor. The conversion to FrameLayout.LayoutParams is performed as a convenience to a caller who may need to set params needed to layout the captions block within its containing CaptionsView (a subclass of FrameLayout).
        Parameters:
        view - the captions block view instance
        Returns:
        a new FrameLayout.LayoutParams instance

      • buildCaptionBlock

        protected android.view.ViewGroup buildCaptionBlock(TTMLDocument document,
                                       BrightcoveClosedCaption closedCaption)
        Inflates a caption_block layout and adds a caption_text element for each line in the caption block. The layout gravity is set on the new caption_block to position the block within the root rectangle and the gravity is set on the caption_text elements to align the text within the block. The displayAlign of the region associated with the caption block, if any, determines the vertical position. The textAlign of the caption block determines the horizontal position and text alignment.

        The initial visibility of the block is set to View.GONE.

        Parameters:
        document - the document containing the caption block and the region definition applicable to the block, if any
        closedCaption - the caption block
        Returns:
        a new caption_block populated with a caption_text element for each line in the caption block

      • buildCaptionBlock

        protected android.view.ViewGroup buildCaptionBlock(WebVTTDocument document,

      • applyRegionLayout

        protected void applyRegionLayout(android.widget.LinearLayout block,
                     TTMLDocument document,
                     BrightcoveClosedCaption closedCaption,
                     int textAlignGravity)
        Applies the layout properties for the region associated with the caption to the block view element. The vertical position of the block is determined by the displayAlign property of the region, if any. The horizontal position of the block is determined by the textAlignGravity param.
        Parameters:
        block - the view container for the caption block
        document - the document containing the caption
        closedCaption - the caption block
        textAlignGravity - the caption text alignment translated to a Gravity value
